author: Staff Reporter
text:
If the All India Samathuva Makkal Katchi (AISMK), headed by Sarath Kumar, wishes to join the Bharatiya Janata Party alliance, the party would welcome it, according to Union Minister of State for Road Transport, Highways and Shipping Pon. Radhakrishnan.

Speaking to reporters here on Friday, Mr. Radhakrishnan said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi was keen on solving the fishermen issue.

He said that Union Minister for Human Resources Smrithi Irani had already explained in detail the alleged suicide of research scholar Rohith Vemula at the University of Hyderabad.

Some vested interests were blocking setting up of ESIC hospital in Nagercoil which needed five acres of land, Mr. Radhakrishnan said.

Earlier, the Minister laid the foundation stone for an overhead tank in Paramanvilai village in Ganapathipuram panchayat in Rajakkamangalam block at an estimated cost of Rs. 10 lakh allocated from the Member of Parliament Local Area Development Scheme.
title: “BJP will welcome SMK into alliance”
